pullRequest.body:
Prove the edges and degrees in the induced subgraphs of `G.support` are equal to the edges and degrees in the original simple graph.

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

will be invisible to reviewers.

Thanks for your PR!

I've two suggestions, but I'm relatively new to reviewing in mathlib, so it could well be someone more knowledgeable has more suggestions later:)
Thanks for the PR! Here are a few comments.

Thanks!

maintainer delegate

bors d+

pending YaÃ«l's suggestions

```suggestion
theorem card_edgeFinset_induce_of_support_subset (h : G.support âŠ† s) :
    #(G.induce s).edgeFinset = #G.edgeFinset := by
  apply card_bij (fun e _ â†¦ e.map (â†‘)) (by rintro âŸ¨x, yâŸ©; simp)
  Â· rintro âŸ¨x1, y1âŸ© _ âŸ¨x1, y1âŸ© _
    simp [Subtype.ext_iff_val]
  Â· rintro âŸ¨v, wâŸ© hadj
    rw [mem_edgeFinset, mem_edgeSet] at hadj
    use s(âŸ¨v, h (G.mem_support.mpr âŸ¨w, hadjâŸ©)âŸ©, âŸ¨w, h (G.mem_support.mpr âŸ¨v, hadj.symmâŸ©)âŸ©)
    simp [hadj]
```

Some golfing suggestions

I didn't know `rintro` worked like that with `Sym2`. :sweat_smile: 

Thanks.
I think you could weaken h to `G.neighborSet v âŠ† s`, that would make this result a bit stronger:)
I've added `degree_induce_of_neighborSet_subset` then prove `degree_induce_of_support_subset` using it.
I'm not sure we want this lemma. It has nothing to do with graphs: It is true for any `s : Set V` instead of `G.support`.

It was there for golfing ErdÅ‘s-Stone-Simonovits, but I don't know why I didn't just inline `set_fintype_card_le_univ G.support` where I needed it. :sweat_smile: 

My bad.
No problem ðŸ˜„

Actually, could you first show
```
theorem map_edgeFinset_induce :
    (G.induce s).edgeFinset.map something_here = {e âˆˆ G.edgeFinset | e.rec (fun (a, b) â†¦ a âˆˆ s âˆ§ b âˆˆ s)  something_here}

theorem map_edgeFinset_induce_of_support_subset (h : G.support âŠ† s) :
    (G.induce s).edgeFinset.map something_here = G.edgeFinset
```
Then your lemma becomes a corollary of those. `map_edgeFinset_induce` would be easier to state if you first introduced `Set.sym2` analogously to `Finset.sym2`
I'll do the same for a `map_neighborFinset_induce` and `map_neighborFinset_induce_of_neighborSet_subset`

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem degree_induce_support (v : G.support) :
```

nit:
```suggestion
    ((G.induce s).neighborFinset v).map (.subtype s) = G.neighborFinset v := by
```
and similar on line 447 of this file

> and similar on line 447 of this file

@b-mehta `invalid dotted identifier notation, expected type must be known`
It looks sensible to me to move this lemma up by two, and put the `[DecidableEq V]` variable declaration after it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): prove finite results for induced subgraphs of `G.support`
